name: Economic Statecraft
objective: To place economics and market forces at the center of U.S. foreign policy by both harnessing global economic forces to advance America’s foreign policy and employing the tools of foreign policy to shore up our economic strength.
beneficiary_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1980. 75 Stat. 890.
Fulbright Hayes Act, the Mutual and Cultural Exchange Act of 1961. Pub. L. 256.
Smith-Mundt Act, U.S. Information and Education Exchange Act of 1948. Pub. L. 80-402.
Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. 75. Pub. L. 87-195.  U.S.C. § 22 USC 2151.
